fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

With [Confluence Server for Slack (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220186/confluence-server-for-slack-official?hosting=server&tab=overview], the list of all connected Slack workspace is visible in Space administration page. It should be restricted for space administrators.
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-22 at 10.10.36.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a permission configuration for workspace visibility.
h3. Why this is important

Workspace can be operated by different organization as well as Space in Confluence. Therefore Space administrator shouldn't be able to see what other workspaces exist.
fields.summary: Slack workspace visibility should be restricted for space administrators in Confluence Server for Slack

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently AdoptOpenJDK is supported as an Oracle JDK alternative ([Is OpenJDK Supported by Confluence?)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/is-openjdk-supported-by-confluence-297667642.html] 
Customers potentially will want to use other OpenJDK solutions moving forward. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Please consider support for other OpenJDKs, specifically:
 Zing OpenJDK [https://www.azul.com/products/zing]

h3. Why this is important
Other OpenJDK solutions will be used by customers

h3. Workaround
Only supported option at this time is AdoptOpenJDK
fields.summary: Confluence support for Zing OpenJDK

fields.description: Since last upgrade I cannot create a new space anymore.
fields.summary: Cannot create a new space

fields.description:
I would like to add a suggestion from one of the groups I support to have the Skill syntax added to the Confluence Code Block Macro.  

Thanks!
fields.summary: Add Skill Syntax to Code Block Macro
Adding panel,excerpt,warning,note,tip or info macro to the page in edit mode will trigger mixed content action in browser

fields.description:
The [User Signup Option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/add-and-invite-users-138313.html#AddandInviteUsers-Manageusersignupnotifications] offers the option to restrict the creation of new accounts by a certain domain. 

If the user attempts to create an account using a domain that doesn't meet the whitelisted criteria, no error or helpful message is given to the user leaving them confused.

This suggestion is to create either an error or helpful message informing the user that the e-mail domain used doesn't meet the server criteria and should reach for the instance admin or any contact from the company hosting the server.
fields.summary: User signup using a non-whitelisted domain should show an error or helpful message

fields.description:
When I add a ToC macro to my page, it automatically becomes a bullet-list. If I want to make it a numbered list, that's doable, but it becomes a bulleted numbered list. This makes the text indentation for the various level very deep _really_ fast (and aesthetically it looks really weird).

My suggestion/request is to make the ToC either a separate choice in the drop-down box, or make the check-box exclusively number the ToC without bullets.
fields.summary: Numbered Table of Content without bullets

fields.description:
While editing a big page in the collaborative mode it is useful sometimes to look at the cursor of other users editing the page. If the page is big, it is difficult to find the cursor: I have to scroll the page up and down hunting for it.

I naturally clicked on the user icon I was interested in (on the top right corner of the page) but unfortunately nothing happened.

I think that clicking on the user icon and having Confluence immediately scroll the page to the user cursor, it would be a useful enhancement to the editor.
fields.summary: Go to user cursor when one clicks on the user icon during collaborative editing

fields.description:
Currently the the width of Bars in the Bar Chart is relative to the height of the whole chart.

For example:
The same Chart height will have the same  width of Bars but with more gaps:
* !Bar1.png|thumbnail!


Reducing the Chart height to reduce the gaps between bars will reduce the width of Bars:
* !Bar2.png|thumbnail!

Therefore, maintaining the width of the bar in the Bar Chart Macro while reducing height of the charts for a small data set is important to for the Charts in a Confluence page to be more consistent.
fields.summary: Maintain the width of the Bar in the Bar Chart Macro while reducing the height of the whole chart to eliminate the gap between bars.

fields.description:
The date picker has been introduced to Confluence for a year or two now which can trigger when tapping //

Can you please develop a command so that users can type @@ twice to bring up a time picker
fields.summary: Time Picker for Confluence

fields.description: It will be great to have the ability to restrict the number of incoming REST API request in a short period to mitigate the situation that the Confluence becomes unresponsive due to a massive number of incoming REST which full fill the Tomcat thread pool.
fields.summary: Adding ability to restrict the number of REST API per user in short period

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to Merge Table Cells in Confluence 6.14 using Firefox and IE 11. This is a [bug in the TinyMCE library| https://github.com/tinymce/tinymce/issues/4914] used by Confluence.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.14.x and above
* Firefox 65.0.1 (64-bit)
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse Confluence using Firefox
 # Create a new page and add in a table with multiple rows and columns (eg: 5 x 5)
 # Highlight 2 cells (vertically or horizontally) and click on the "Merge table cells"

h3. Expected Results

The highlighted table cells are merged after clicking the button
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happened
 [^cell merge firefox.mp4]
h3. Information
 * Highlighting multiple cells from different columns and rows (eg: 2 x 2) will allow the cell merge to work properly
 * This means after highlighting multiple cells from different columns and rows and then continue to drag the cursor back to 2 cells, 2 of the cells can be merged in this method (refers to the end of video above)
 * This issue is not replicable in Confluence 6.11.2.
* This issue is caused by the [Confluence 6.14 Editor Update|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-6-14-release-notes-963655609.html#Confluence6.14ReleaseNotes-Massiveeditorimprovements].

h3. Workaround
 # Edit using another browser (eg: Chrome)
 # For Firefox, refer to the second point in *Information* above.
 # For IE:
#* Select the cells you want to merge
#* Right-click the merge-button in the editor toolbar
#* Left-click the merge button
fields.summary: Unable to Merge Table Cells in Confluence 6.14 using Firefox and IE 11

fields.description: Currently, Confluence supports MySQL.  This request is to also include Confluence support for the MariaDB fork from MySQL.
fields.summary: Support for MariaDB

fields.description:
A lot of times when adding content to a Confluence page and adding macros, the macros are accidentally wrapped in heading tags .e.g. <h1>

This causes, confusion within users as it is not directly clear that the macro is wrapped in the heading tag but at the same time the display of that macro seems off.

Example:
 # Lets assume we have couple of h2 section headings. 
 !image001.png|thumbnail!
 # When a user tries to add a Table of Content Macro, what they normally do is head to the start of the first line where the first heading is located and add the Table of Content Macro there and then press enter. 
 # When this is performed, the <h2> tag is actually accidentally wraps the Table of Content as well, causing undesirable extra bullet on the Table of Content. 
  !image002.png|thumbnail! 

It would be great to have an automatic mechanism to stop such things from happening.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism to ensure that headings (h1,h2,h3..) do not accidentally wrap macros.

Please, add the new templates also to Confluence Server

[https://www.atlassian.com/blog/confluence/new-templates-for-confluence]
fields.summary: Add the new templates to Confluence Server
After Confluence upgrade, The duplicate index and incorrect data type caused MSSQL Database CPU spike

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When a page has certain macros it makes the top header not fixed, which means when you scroll the page down the top bar disappears from view. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and add some lines of content to make it scrollable
 # Add the Roadmap Planner or the Change History macro at the bottom

h3. Known Macros that cause the issue
 # Roadmap Planner
 # Change History macros

h3. Expected Results

Scrolling down the page the top header would be fixed
h3. Actual Results

The top header goes away
h3. Notes

The browser's development tools shows the header with a missing class element
{code:java}
<header id="header" role="banner">{code}
Whereas a working page would show and additional "class" element that upon scrolling would add the fixed-header valure:
{code:java}
<header id="header" role="banner" class="fixed-header">{code}
fields.summary: Top header not fixed when page contains certain macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Dashboard, Space List as well as in Configuration page, the top bar are not sticky. Meaning, that when a user scrolls down, the top bar does not remain visible in the screen. When navigating to other user generated pages, the top bar is sticky (visible when user is scrolling)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Headover to Dashboard, Space Directory or/and Configuration page 
 # Notice the top bar.
 # Scroll down

h3. Expected Results

The expected result is that the top bar remains visible even when scrolling.

 

Workaround

At the moment there is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Top bar is not sticky at Dashboard, Space Directory and in Configuration page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Exporting a page to a PDF file doesn't render a Confluence image when the following conditions are met: * The image is added to the exported page by using its link, not as an attachment. * The Space holding the above image is *not* accessible to anonymous user. ** Either by Space or Global permissions. * The image is still rendered in the exported page. h3. Environment This issue was validated on multiple versions from *6.1.0* to *6.13.2*. The described use case was still working as expected on Confluence *6.0.7*. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Fresh install of Confluence *6.13.2*. # Enable _Anonymous Access_ on [Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/global-permissions-overview-138709.html]. #* Enable both _Use Confluence_ and _View User Profiles_. !global_permissions_img001.png|thumbnail! # Create a Space named _Space Anonymous Access Enabled_ with Space Key _SAAE_. # In Space _SAAE_ [enable the _View_ permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/space-permissions-overview-139521.html] to anonymous users. !space_permissions_img001.png|thumbnail! # In Space _SAAE_, create an unrestricted page named _Page with Image_ and attach an image to it. !sample_page_img001.png|thumbnail! # Create a Space named _PDF Export Test_ with Space Key _PET_. #* This space should have regular access to confluence users, but *no* access to anonymous. # Create an unrestricted page named _Export Page_ in Space _PET_. #* This page should contain 3 images: 1) an image *attached* to the page; 2) an image as a *link* to the image attached to the same page; and 3) an image as a *link* to the image in _Page with Image_. #* The storage format of this page will look similar to the one below. {code}

Attached image


Link to Confluence image within the same page


Link to Confluence image within a Space accessible by anonymous user

{code} !sample_page_img002.png|thumbnail! # [Export page _Export Page_ as a PDF|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-139475.html#ExportContenttoWord,PDF,HTMLandXML-ExportsinglepagestoPDF]. h3. Expected Results The exported PDF file should have all 3 images rendered, since all of them are accessible to the user when accessing the page from the web UI. The PDF file should look like this: [^PET-ExportPage-607.pdf] h3. Actual Results The exported PDF file does not render the image that uses the link to the image attached to _Export Page_. The PDF file looks like the following: [^PET-ExportPage-610.pdf] h3. Notes The problem is *not* related to a link to an image in the same page, but the fact that its Space does not allow anonymous access. However, this should not be a problem, since the user exporting the page has view access to the image. The below query may help the Confluence administrator to find the pages that are potentially affected by this bug and notify the page creators by e-mail: {code} select c.contentid as pageID, c.title as pageTitle, s.spacekey as spaceKey, 'CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=' || c.contentid as pageLink, um.username pageCreator, cu.lower_email_address as pageCreatorEmail from bodycontent bc join content c on c.contentid=bc.contentid join spaces s on s.spaceid=c.spaceid join user_mapping um on c.creator=um.user_key join cwd_user cu on cu.lower_user_name=um.lower_username where (bc.body like '%/download/thumbnails%' OR bc.body like '%/download/attachments%') and c.contenttype = 'PAGE' and c.prevver is NULL ; {code} (!) This query was validated on PostgreSQL; you may need to change it according to your database flavor. (!) Change _CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL_ to your Base URL to get accurate links to the affected pages. h3. Workaround Instead of using a web link to the image, use the [_Insert a file attached to another page_|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/display-files-and-images-245827130.html#DisplayFilesandImages-FromAnotherPageInsertafileattachedtoanotherpage] functionality. You may also use the Marketplace App [_Scroll PDF Exporter for Confluence_|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/7019/scroll-pdf-exporter-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview], since it deals well with the scenario described in this bug report. As an alternative, the user can rely on browser's functionality to save the current web page as a PDF file.
fields.summary: Exporting a page to PDF does not include internal images when they are added as URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence 6.14.x, we added a new search window, on the right side of it, there's a Search tips link, clicking on it would lead you to our Search guide:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html]

If we change the language at the user profile to something other than English (US) and (UK), the link is broken and, instead of redirecting to the correct page, we does a search at CAC (confluence.atlassian.com) for the word "search" in the language that was changed to, for example, if we change to Deutsch, it will search for "suchen".
  
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.14.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 6.14.x
 # Click on the search bar, on the new window, click on Search tips or on the language you've chosen that the link was translated to

h3. Expected Results

Will open a new tab showing our Search guide:
 - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/search-139528.html]

h3. Actual Results

Will open a new tab and will run a search for the word "Search" in the language chosen, for example:
 - Deutsch, will redirect to: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Suche]
 - Eesti, will redirect to: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Otsi]

h3. Workaround

Since changing the language to english just to have that link correctly won't be done, there are no workarounds.
fields.summary: Search tips link is broken when using a different language than English (US/UK)

fields.description:
h3. Description
Some customer uses Confluence and created a user in the internal directory before implementing a JIRA application. Once they implemented JIRA, they would like to import the user from Confluence internal user directory to avoid recreating the user account in JIRA again. As for now, Confluence does not have the feature to export user from internal user directory to JIRA.

h3. Suggestion
Provide a feature to export user from Confluence internal user directory and import it to JIRA
fields.summary: Provide feature to allow admin export user from internal user directory to JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When users with spaces in their usernames are sync'd into Confluence from an external directory (e.g. Active Directory), they are unable to reset their password due to the following error:
bq. The reset password token you have provided is no longer valid.

h3. How to replicate
# Set up a mail server with Confluence..
# Sync a user directory containing a user whose username is in the following format: "FirstName LastName", whereby there is a space that separates the two names. For example, "Kent ng".
# Logout and click on "Forgot your password?" on the login page.
# Enter your username or e-mail address into the field and click on "Send it to me".
# Check your e-mail for an e-mail from Confluence and click on the "Reset Password" button in the e-mail.
# Enter your new password twice and click on "Reset".

h3. Expected results
The password should be successfully changed.

h3. Actual results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Change the AD to read and write and let the admin to reset the password for the user from Confluence {{Users}} page or reset the password from the external AD.
fields.summary: Password reset fails for users with spaces in their names is not working

fields.description:
h4. Description

On confluence 6.14.x onward, a scheduled job was implemented called "Repair the Ancestors Table". This job was created, as the name implies, to search for corrupt entries in the ancestor table and correct them at 3AM each day.
h4. Expected results

The scheduled job was supposed to run, check the data, perform the correction and close itself.
h4. Actual result

The Scheduled job runs however it does not close itself and remain in memory as a open transaction.
h4. How to replicate and behavior observed

Install a Confluence 6.14 or newer. Go to Confluence administration -> scheduled jobs and run manually the "Repair the Ancestors Table". Or wait for it to run at 3AM each day.

On a MSSQL database, run this query which will show the open transactions:
{code:java}
select * from sys.dm_exec_sessions where open_transaction_count > 0
{code}
This transaction won't be removed unless killed manually.

This was tested on a MYSQL database with the same result. The transaction was not finished after the scheduled job ended. Using this query will show the transaction opened:
{code:java}
SELECT * FROM information_schema.innodb_trx;
{code}
The other databases, Postgres and Oracle, should be affected as well.

This appears in the confluence logs using SQL logging enabled:
{code:java}
2019-02-15 19:46:29,779 TRACE [Caesium-1-2] [type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder] bind binding parameter [1] as [VARCHAR] - [AncestorsRepairJob-runNow-1550267189523]
2019-02-15 19:46:29,780 TRACE [Caesium-1-2] [type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder] bind binding parameter [2] as [TIMESTAMP] - [Fri Feb 15 19:46:29 BRST 2019]
2019-02-15 19:46:29,780 TRACE [Caesium-1-2] [type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder] bind binding parameter [3] as [BIGINT] - [205]
2019-02-15 19:46:29,780 TRACE [Caesium-1-2] [type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder] bind binding parameter [4] as [CHAR] - [S]
2019-02-15 19:46:29,781 TRACE [Caesium-1-2] [type.descriptor.sql.BasicBinder] bind binding parameter [5] as [VARCHAR] - [Ancestors were repaired successfully]
{code}
 * Another behavior observed within a customer environment, which might increase the severity of this bug, is that the transaction opened consumed disk space. For one case, it consumed 1GB per day and over the week it reached 6.4GB so this bug could cause a out of memory on the server if the transaction is not killed.

h4. Suggested Workaround

Disable the scheduled job "Repair the Ancestors Table" so it won't run during 3AM. OR kill the transaction manually in the database.
fields.summary: Repair ancestor table scheduled job DB transaction is stuck

fields.description:
In confluence.cfg.xml it is required to have either confluence.cluster.aws.iam.role or confluence.cluster.aws.iam.key specified.

If neither one is specified, then catalina.out will log:
{quote}com.atlassian.config.bootstrap.BootstrapException: Unable to bootstrap application: Exception bootstrapping cluster:Error bootstrapping cluster (error.cluster.aws.iam.role.and.access.key.not.defined)
{quote}
I believe Hazelcast can default to using the IAM Role assigned to the EC2 Instance, but the ConfluenceConfigurationListener component is not allowing for this functionality to occur.

This suggestion would just help administrators simplifying configurations and allow for more flexibility in their configuration options.

Note: I am not and cannot use the cloudformation provided by Atlassian for deploying Conflunce Data center in AWS.
fields.summary: Make AWS Clustering IAM role and access key optional

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Confluence Editor has a feature to add comments when publishing a new version of an existing page.
This feature is described in [The Editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-editor-251006017.html#TheEditor-changecomment] product documentation.

This feature is not available when creating a new page, which would be important to record the reasoning of creating that page.
For example of a use case, when a page is migrated from another Wiki solution to Confluence, it would be interesting to add a version comment when the page is created (through the REST API in this use case).

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the _change comment_ feature available in the Confluence Editor when creating a new page.
Make it available on the REST API as well.
 
h3. Workaround 
*When using the UI and the REST API*:
# Create a page with just a title and do not add any content.
# Edit the same page with the actual content and add the version comment, treating the version 2 of the page as the version 1.
fields.summary: As a Confluence user I would like to add a version comment when creating a new page

fields.description:
By default, Confluence replaces the attachment's version attached in a page with the older version when user drag and drop an attachment with the same filename similar to existing file in a page without a warning.

It will be more convenient to have a warning message to prevent user from accidentally drag and drop an attachment with the same filename that contain a completely different content in it.
fields.summary: Introduce warning message when user drag and drop an attachment with the same filename similar to existing file in a page.

fields.description:
Currently the JIRA chart macro only provide limited choices when it comes to the charts that it supports. This limits the ability of Confluence connected JIRA users to have a direct way to represent JIRA data.

At the moment here are the available charts:
Pie Chart
2Dimensional 
and Created Vs Resolved. 

Having the following charts would greatly improve the usability of the macro. 
Bar chart
Bar stacked chart
fields.summary: JIRA Chart Macro should have more chart options

fields.description: Extend the Livesearch or Page Tree Search Macro to also search in a given Jira or Jira Service Desk project that will improve the integration between Confluence and Jira.
fields.summary: Ability to search Jira content in Confluence

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
Users are being redirected to the Confluence URL when 'Forgot your Password' link is clicked in the Confluence Application.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Click 'Forgot your password?' in Confluence's login page
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Enter valid email address
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
# The email provides Confluence password change URL
 !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
# When you click on the link it redirects to the 'Forgot your password?' page again.
 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Suggestion
* Users should be redirected to the Crowd console to reset their password when Crowd is being configured as User management directory in Confluence.
* User should receive email with 'Crowd URL' to change their password instead of 'Confluence URL'
fields.summary: Redirect user to Crowd console when clicking on 'Forgot your password?'

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to update or edit page restrictions through the Confluence API. 

This is possible in Confluence Cloud, per the [Confluence Cloud API documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/?_ga=2.242477058.1405191471.1549894744-1705418969.1518219027#api-content-id-property-key-delete]. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a similar method/endpoint for the Confluence Server API.

h3. Why this is important
If administrators need to update a large number of page restrictions, the API would be helpful for automating some of this work. 

h3. Workaround 
The [Bob Swift Confluence CLI|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSOAP/overview] can achieve this objective.
fields.summary: Edit Page Restrictions through the API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a Data Center environment, an administrator may find that within Confluence Admin > Clustering, the user interface shows that nodes are unable to reach one another other with errors like:
{quote}
The node [xxxxxx] is temporarily not reachable. Please check the server logs.
{quote}

The actual cluster is up and running, despite what the UI is suggesting. However, the message in the UI is alarming to administrators and should be corrected.

h3. Environment
This issue was first observed in a 2-node Confluence Data Center 6.6.3 cluster using AWS cluster join method. Both nodes were using Java 8 update 162:
{code}
<java.runtime.version>1.8.0_162-b12</java.runtime.version>
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Unknown, the issue may be intermittent as {{serialVersionUID}} looks to be auto-generated by the JVM at run time.

h3. Expected Results
Cluster Monitoring UI shows that nodes are able to communicate with each other.

h3. Actual Results
Cluster Monitoring UI shows that nodes cannot reach one another. However, the actual cluster itself is up and running, despite what this UI is saying.

Logs the following corresponding warnings:
{code}
2019-02-13 09:22:37,800 WARN [ajp-nio-127.0.0.1-8009-exec-194] [cluster.hazelcast.monitoring.HazelcastClusterMonitoring] getData Exception happened when receiving response from node 438b4c58
 -- referer: https://example.confluence.com:9443/plugins/servlet/cluster-monitoring | url: /rest/atlassian-cluster-monitoring/cluster/suppliers/data/com.atlassian.cluster.monitoring.cluster-monitoring-plugin/runtime-information/438b4c58 | traceId: 9c5a10920fd04be5 | userName: admin
java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.hazelcast.nio.serialization.HazelcastSerializationException: java.io.InvalidClassException: com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.hazelcast.monitoring.RemoteModuleCallable; local class incompatible: stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 597473803974431210, local class serialVersionUID = 2184010817253012516

	at com.hazelcast.util.executor.DelegatingFuture.get(DelegatingFuture.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.hazelcast.monitoring.HazelcastClusterMonitoring.getData(HazelcastClusterMonitoring.java:79)
...
Caused by: com.hazelcast.nio.serialization.HazelcastSerializationException: java.io.InvalidClassException: com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.hazelcast.monitoring.RemoteModuleCallable; local class incompatible: stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 597473803974431210, local class serialVersionUID = 2184010817253012516
...
Caused by: java.io.InvalidClassException: com.atlassian.confluence.cluster.hazelcast.monitoring.RemoteModuleCallable; local class incompatible: stream classdesc serialVersionUID = 597473803974431210, local class serialVersionUID = 2184010817253012516
	at java.io.ObjectStreamClass.initNonProxy(ObjectStreamClass.java:687)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readNonProxyDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1876)
	at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readClassDesc(ObjectInputStream.java:1745)

 -- referer: https://example.confluence.com:9443/plugins/servlet/cluster-monitoring | url: /rest/atlassian-cluster-monitoring/cluster/suppliers/data/com.atlassian.cluster.monitoring.cluster-monitoring-plugin/runtime-information/438b4c58 | traceId: 9c5a10920fd04be5 | userName: admin
{code}

h3. Notes
Some notes from Development review:
{quote}
We should manually set the `serialVersionUID` in the class `RemoteModuleCallable`, instead of having it autogenerate. Usually, that generated ID is going to be the same in both nodes, but because this is done by the JVM internally, any minute differences in the environment or just due to sheer luck, a different ID gets generated by different nodes.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
Restarting Confluence _may_ help, but due to the random nature of this problem, it is not 100% guaranteed to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Cluster Monitoring panel shows that nodes are unable to reach each other due to mismatched "serialVersionUID" values for in the "RemoteModuleCallable" class

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
AFter a user upgrades to 6.13, there is log WARNings about duplicate packages. Users are unsure if there is a functional impact or if they should intervene in some way. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade from Confluence 6.6. to 6.13
# Tail the logs after 6.13 start up

h3. Expected Results
No warnings about duplicates

h3. Actual Results
You receive the following in the logs: 

{code}
2019-02-07 16:43:34,940 WARN [localhost-startStop-2] [org.twdata.pkgscanner.ExportPackageListBuilder] logDuplicateWarning Package Scanner found duplicates for package 'javax.annotation' with different versions. Files: jsr305-3.0.1.jar and javax.annotation-api-1.3.2.jar
  '/data/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence-6.13.1/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/jsr305-3.0.1.jar'
  '/data/atlassian/confluence/atlassian-confluence-6.13.1/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/javax.annotation-api-1.3.2.jar'
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Notes
There doesn't appear to be any functional impact to this other than creating uncertainty in the users and subsequently contacting support to ask for guidance on whether they need to address the duplicate issue
fields.summary: WARN about Duplicate Packages after Upgrade to 6.13

The Spaces List Macro provides a link to each space's home page on the list, however the URL on the link is not a direct link to the page itself, which stops any macro/add-on that uses that URL from working correctly. This occurs regardless of whether the Space home page is the default one or not.

 # Create a page and include the Spaces List macro in it
 # Check the URLs the macro links to

h3. Expected Results

The Space home page's URL would be linked, the same link that appears when you go to the Space via the Space directory:

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

* Is is not possible to install Confluence using the Linux installer (.bin format) in OpenSUSE Tumbleweed.

h3. Environment 
* Linux OpenSUSE Tumbleweed
* Fedora29

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Download the Linux installer (.bin format)
# Make the installer executable
# Run the installer

h3. Expected Results  

* You'll be able to proceed with the installation normally, following the steps described in [Installing Confluence on Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/installing-confluence-on-linux-143556824.html]

h3. Actual Results 

* In Confluence 6.14, as soon as you execute the .bin file, the following message is shown:
{code}
./atlassian-confluence-6.14.1-x64.bin 
WARNING: Please make sure fontconfig is installed in your Linux distribution for Confluence installation.
            Visit KB article for more information. https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/JP06OQ
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
/opt/atlassian/atlassian-confluence-6.14.1-x64.bin.2783.dir/jre/bin/java: symbol lookup error: /usr/lib64/libfontconfig.so.1: undefined symbol: FT_Done_MM_Var
{code}

or 

{code:borderStyle=solid}
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
java.lang.NullPointerException
at sun.awt.FontConfiguration.getVersion(FontConfiguration.java:1264)
at sun.awt.FontConfiguration.readFontConfigFile(FontConfiguration.java:219)
at sun.awt.FontConfiguration.init(FontConfiguration.java:107)
at sun.awt.X11FontManager.createFontConfiguration(X11FontManager.java:774)
{code}

h3. Notes 
* In OpenSUSE Tumbleweed, the _fontconfig_ is already installed, but its dependency, _fontconfig2_, is replaced by the _libfreetype6_ package.
* A similar issue was reported in [Confluence Server 6.13 or later fails with library not loaded error when starting up on MacOS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/confluence-server-6-13-or-later-fails-with-library-not-loaded-error-when-starting-up-on-macos-961781427.html], but the workaround proposed by it isn't possible because the installer doesn't start at all.
* Also, it seems like this issue is related to AdoptOpenJDK 8 having a broken dependency on _libfreetype.6.dylib_, but trying to install Confluence 6.12 through the installer also fails.

h3. Workaround 
* Install Confluence using the _tar.gz_ file.
fields.summary: Installing Confluence in OpenSUSE Tumbleweed through the installer fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
[Comparing two versions of a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-139379.html#PageHistoryandPageComparisonViews-Comparetwoversions] consumes a high amount of memory and might contribute to out of memory errors.

This is intensified when the _Send batched notifications_ scheduled job runs and needs to send e-mails about changed content.

How to identify if the bug is affecting your instance during periods of high load:
# High heap usage.
# High GC activity, including concurrent and Full GC.
# If a heap dump is taken, you will notice a significant number of instances (reachable or unreachable) of any of the below classes.
 #* {{org.eclipse.compare.rangedifferencer}}
 #* {{com.atlassian.confluence.diff}}
 #* {{org.outerj.daisy.diff}}


h3. Environment
This was validated on Confluence Server on version *6.13.2*.
It can definitely impact 6.14.1 since there were no improvements on that area, but wasn't tested on that version.
This affects Confluence Server or Data Center on any version prior (and including) to the highlighted above.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Fresh install of Confluence.
# Start your preferred [live monitoring tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/live-monitoring-using-the-jmx-interface-150274182.html] and start to monitor your Confluence instance.
 #* _Jconsole_ is used throughout this test.
# Create a test space named _Test Page Comparison_.
# Create a sample page named _Sample Page Comparison_ and publish the 1st version with no contents.
# Edit and publish a new version of the page with the contents from [^sample_page_v1.txt] storage format.
 #* You need to use the [Source Editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/confluence-storage-format-964960676.html] to edit the storage format of a page.
# Edit and publish a new version of the page with the contents from [^sample_page_v2.txt] storage format.
# Access the _Page History_ of _Sample Page Comparison_ and at this point you should have 3 versions as the image below.
 !page_history_img001.png|thumbnail! 
 #* Keep this page opened in a tab.
# In a new tab, access the [Cache Statistics admin page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/cache-statistics-150472.html] and flush *all* caches.
# Go back to the tab with the _Page History_ of _Sample Page Comparison_ opened.
# Select _v. 2_ and _CURRENT (v. 3)_ and click on _Compare selected versions_.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence performs page comparison using minimum server resources.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence uses a lot of heap to perform page comparison.
 !jmx_comparing_sample_page_img001.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The situation may get worse on large Confluence instances, such as on Enterprise deployments with Confluence Data Centers, on which users perform multiple changes on pages of different complexity.
When the _Send batched notifications_ scheduled job runs it will compare versions of watched pages and send e-mails to users.
This requires more heap and CPU resources as shown in the below graph after 5 pages were edited with the same contents as the example above.
 !jmx_batch_notification_5pages_img002.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Performance on Scale
There are some situations on which the performance is impacted depending on the scale:
# Heap usage increases depending on the number of watchers on the page -- for cases triggered by the batch notifications job.
# Heap usage increases depending on the number of pages to be processed -- for cases triggered by the batch notifications job.
# Heap usage increases depending on the complexity of the page and the changes between versions.

h5. Number of watchers of the page
 !jconsole_img001.png|thumbnail! 
*1 watcher on a sample page*

 !jconsole_img002.png|thumbnail! 
*1,000 watchers on the same page*


h5. Number of pages to process
 !jconsole_img005.png|thumbnail! 
*10 pages with 1 watcher per page*

 !jconsole_img006.png|thumbnail! 
*250 pages with 1 watcher per page*

h3. Workaround
There's no workaround when the user needs to compare page versions from the web UI.
To minimize the impact that could be caused by the _Send batched notifications_ scheduled job, users must disable the _Show changed content_ option in their [Email Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html] option.
There's an enhancement request to globally disable this functionality, as described in [CONFSERVER-43671|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43671]. You may want to check one of the workarounds described in [this suggestion report|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43671].

As a practical example of the benefits of disabling this functionality on all users, the screenshot below shows heap and CPU usage while running the _Send batched notifications_ on the same scenario of the _Notes Section_, but all users watching all pages had the _Show changed content_ option disabled.
 !jmx_batch_notification_5pages_noContent_img001.png|thumbnail! 
 Users will still receive an e-mail notifying changes on the watched page, but no page comparison is run.

h3. Further Reading
[Page History and Page Comparison|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-history-and-page-comparison-views-139379.html]
[Email Notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/email-notifications-145162.html]
[How to globally disable e-mail notifications with page content|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-globally-disable-e-mail-notifications-with-page-content-718670714.html]
[CONFSERVER-43671|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43671] -- _Ability to disable "Show Changed Content" site-wide_
fields.summary: Page comparison in Confluence has a high heap usage and might contribute to OOM errors

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Have a plugin with a REST API deployed that specifies a package: *applinks-oauth*:

{code:xml}
<rest key="applinksRestV2OAuth" path="/applinks-oauth" version="1.0" description="Provides REST endpoints for interacting with the AppLinks OAuth plugin"><package>com.atlassian.applinks.oauth.rest</package></rest>
{code}

# Open the *REST API Browser version 3.2.2* on a *Confluence 6.13.2* 
# Deselect "Show only public APIs"
# Type "applinks-oauth" in the browser
# Notice that the  path is duplicated:
 !image2019-2-8_15-42-1.jpg|thumbnail! 

{{applinks-oauth/1.0/applinks-oauth/1.0}}

instead of 

{{applinks-oauth/1.0}}

Since the path is wrong a call of the service via the REST API Browser results in a HTTP 404.

*Expected Result*
Incorrect paths resulting in a 404 when called with the REST API Browser.

*Actual Result*
Proper URLs to the REST services of a add-on that specifies a <package> element.

h3. Notes

* When {{package}} element is present in the rest module then you get a duplicate path
* On a *Confluence 5.10.9* this is not a problem. All URLs are correctly shown with *REST API Browser version 3.2.2*.
* Add-ons that do not specify the <package> element work fine.
* If the {{package}} element is removed, then the REST API Browser works fine even with *Confluence 6.13.2*. 
* The REST API service is usable outside of the REST API Browser. However, the REST API Browser happens to display incorrect URLs (with the duplication) and each call will results in a 404.
fields.summary: Path problems with the REST API Browser under some Confluence versions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If more than one user is editing the same document in Companion App, there is no warning, and the last person to save the document will overwrite any other changes made by previous users.
h3. Suggested Solution
Implement concurrent editing or warn when another user is editing the document to prevent overwrites.

h3. Why this is important
Currently, a user could lose a lot of work they've done if they are unaware that another user is editing.
 
h3. Workaround 
No current workaround.
fields.summary: Implement concurrent editing of documents using Companion App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Companion app leaks memory if the process is started twice.


{panel:title=Issue fixed on Atlassian Companion App version 0.6.0|borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#f7d6c1|bgColor=#ffffce}
 # There will still be *two processes* running for the Companion app even on 0.6.0.
 # But there should be only *one instance* of the app, which can be see with there being only one Companion App icon on the task-bar.{panel}
h3. Environment
 * Only observed on Windows
 * App installed with *.msi* file

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the Companion app with the *.msi* file using the following script
 ** For 32-bit OS:
{code:java}
msiexec /qn /i "Atlassian Companion.msi"
reg add "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v "electron.app.Atlassian Companion" /d "\"C:\Program Files\Atlassian Companion\Atlassian Companion.exe\"" /f
{code}

 ** For 64-bit OS:
{code:java}
msiexec /qn /i "Atlassian Companion.msi"
reg add "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" /v "electron.app.Atlassian Companion" /d "\"C:\Program Files (x86)\Atlassian Companion\Atlassian Companion.exe\"" /f
{code}

 # Reboot the computer

h3. Expected Results

The app is started normally and no duplicate processes or memory issues are observed.
h3. Actual Results

Duplicate processes for the app are observed, as we can see here:

!task-manager-view.png|thumbnail!

One of the processes will *leak memory at a rate of around 20 bytes per second*. We have some cases where the memory usage reached more than 1GB before the app crashed after running in this situation for a few hours.
h3. Notes

The installation method that triggers this situation is a workaround for the following bugs:
 # https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57792
 # https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57541

After running this installation method and rebooting the computer, we end up having two entries on the registry that trigger the app startup, one under the key *HKEY_CURRENT_USER* and the other under *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE*.

Even though this is not triggered under normal circumstances, the idea of this bug is that one of the following situations must be avoided:
 # The app should check if it is already running before starting a new process, or
 # If the possibility of having two processes is expected, the secondary process should not leak memory

If the app has one of those protection mechanisms bundled, we exclude the possibility of compromising the end-user computer resources.
h3. Workaround 1

Remove one of the registry entries (either from HKLM or HKCU tree), which can be done by an administrator. Only one of the following entries must exist in the registry:
{code:java}
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
{code}
{code:java}
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
{code}
(!) For a 64 bit OS, the registry tree looks like this:
{code:java}
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run
{code}
h3. Workaround 2

Uncheck the *Launch at startup* box on the app itself, which can be done by the end user. This will effectively remove the registry entry from *HKEY_CURRENT_USER*, but the app will still start automatically on reboot due to the entry under *HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE*.
fields.summary: Companion app leaks memory if the process is started twice
Ability to change the text of the Macro Browser window

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When a user created a new page on Confluence and pasted a Jira issue link, Confluence wouldn't auto-create Jira macro for this link. Once the page is published and we edit and pasted the Jira issue link again, Confluence would auto-create the Jira Macro.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.6.x
* Jira 7.6.9, 7.10.x, 8.5.0
* Application Link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a new page
* Paste a link to a Jira issue
* Save the page

h3. Expected Results
* Jira Issue should auto-convert to Jira Issue Macro.

h3. Actual Results
* Confluence wouldn't auto-create Jira macro for this link. Once the page is published and we edit and pasted the Jira issue link again, Confluence would auto-create the Jira Macro.

h3. Notes
* Once we edited the page and paste the Jira issue link again, Confluence would auto-convert the link to a Jira Issue macro
* The issue is reproducible in Confluence 6.6.8 and 6.6.10 version and Jira version 7.6.9
* This issue is also reproducible if above-mentioned Confluence version is linked with Jira version above 7.10 as well

h3. Workarounds
* When creating a new page, save and then edit before pasting Jira issue links
* Use the Insert option from the top right and choose Jira Issue/Filter
fields.summary: JIRA links fail to auto-convert to JIRA macros

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When two large instances of Confluence need to be merged the process of exporting and importing spaces individually becomes very cumbersome

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be useful to have support for support importing multiple Confluence Server spaces.
A tool similar to the [Cloud Migration Assistance for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/migrate-from-confluence-server-to-cloud-724765529.html] could work

h3. Workaround 
# Export spaces by either:
## Individually [Export the desired space as a full XML backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/export-content-to-word-pdf-html-and-xml-139475.html]
## Or per this [community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/Is-there-a-way-to-mass-export-spaces/qaq-p/244098], utilize [Bob Swift's Confluence Command Line Interface (CLI)'s|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/284/confluence-command-line-interface-cli] and its [exportSpace|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/display/CSOAP/Reference#Reference-exportSpace] action to bulk export spaces to XML
# [Restore each of the spaces to target Confluence instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-space-152036.html]
* (!) You can't import into an earlier version of Confluence. So if the Confluence instances are on different versions, you may be limited by this and need to upgrade
** For example, if you export a space from Confluence 5.9, you can't import it into Confluence 5.5.
* (!) If the space to be imported is very large, you may need to temporarily increase the memory available to Confluence. See [How to fix out of memory errors by increasing available memory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-fix-out-of-memory-errors-by-increasing-available-memory-154071.html]
fields.summary: Support the Merging Confluence Server Spaces into Single Instance for Confluence Server

There should be a confirmation dialog allowing the user to postpone or abort the rebuild.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* The *Delete Own* space permission is meant to give you permission to delete any pages, blogs, attachments and comments you've created in this space (regardless of whether other users have subsequently edited the content), according to our documentation ([Space Permissions Overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/space-permissions-overview-964960242.html]). This means that in case this permission is disabled, it shouldn't allow a user to delete the own user's content created, however, even though this permission is disabled, we are still able to delete our own comments/pages/etc.

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Create a user who is a member of the _confluence-users_ group only (user doesn't have administration permissions) 
# In a specific space, go to *Space Tools >> Permissions >> Edit Permissions*
## Remove all group permissions, by deselecting all the permissions applied to each group
## Add the user individually and grant this user the following permissions:
##* *All - View*
##* *Pages - Add*
##* *Blog - Add*
##* *Attachments - Add*
##* *Comments - Add*
## Save the changes made
## Have this user comment on a page and refresh the page

h3. Expected Results

* The user is able to add a comment, but cannot delete it.

h3. Actual Results

* The user adds a comment and not only the *Delete* option is available, but is also functional, allowing the user to delete his own content (even though the *Delete Own* permission is disabled).

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Disabling the Delete Own permission still allows the users to delete their own content

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Currently, the Global and Space Activity of Confluence shows pre-defined information about an instance, without the possibility of customizing it.

h3. Suggested Solution

* Add the ability for our customers to customize what information they would like to have displayed in their Global and Space Activity.

h3. Why this is important

* Each company has its own necessary information for creating reports and auditing purposes. Some information shown in the Global and Space Activity might not be very relevant to display, so customizing this area would reduce the unnecessary content shown.
fields.summary: Customize Global and Space Activity

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently, there isn't an option to give a user access to the General Configuration screen or the Space Tools unless the user is a Confluence administrator or a space administrator.

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Create a middle permission role, where a user can access this information available on the Confluence's administration screen (as well as the space's administration area) but cannot edit any information of it.

h3. Why this is important
 * This is important to companies who wish to give some users access to their instance's information for auditing purposes, without risking having these users edit any settings of the instance.
fields.summary: Read-only administrator permission

fields.description:
In our templates we need to include detailed instructions and examples how to fill them with content. The existing instructional text-feature is not enough, as it 
 * can only hold one line
 * can't accept formatting
 * is indexed and leads to misleading matches in search.
 * is copied on creating a page from the template.

We suggest a new macro *"instructional section"*.
 * Shown only in edit mode
 * Rich formatting
 * Content can't be changed by the page editor
 * Page-Editor can hide/unhide  all instructional sections 
 * Content is not indexed.
 * Multiple instructional sections can be interspersed with normal content, so that the instructions can be freely placed where  needed.
 * Instructional sections should be clearly discernible, for example by special background color or some other adornment
 * Content is NOT copied to the page on creation, but rather is referencing the text from the template. Changes to an instructional section in the template are reflected while editing existing pages based on the template.

Of course, the last point means the page has to maintain a link to the template it was created from. If that is too much of a breaking change, an alternative approach would be to have the instructional section macro reference a section in a helper-page. But this reference has to be rendered in edit-mode, which normal macros can't do.

*This enables teams to create and maintain consistent documentation.*
fields.summary: instructional sections in templates

fields.description:
Currently, TLS 1.0 is used when *Use TLS* option is checked in *Confluence Mail Server Configuration* while TLS 1.2 is used in Jira Mail Server SMTP Protocol.

Therefore, it would be more convenient to *enforce TLS v1.2 for the Confluence Mail Server SMTP Protocol*.
h4.  Workaround

Add the following parameter in Confluence system properties:
{code:java}
-Dmail.smtp.ssl.protocols=TLSv1.2
{code}
(i) Please refer to [Configuring System properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] to add the parameter.
fields.summary: Enforce TLS v1.2 for the Confluence Mail Server SMTP Protocol

fields.description:
Hi,

I contacted customer support with this request and they recommend I open an issue here.

I am a developer for a government contractor attempting to bring Confluence Mobile to our company. One of our requirements for mobile applications is they must run in Blackberry UEM, an encryption service that protects sensitive data.

The team managing Blackberry UEM has requested of me unsigned binaries for Confluence Mobile so we can repackage them and run them in our environment. My understanding is these are .ipa and .apk files which have not yet been signed with a distributor's certificate.

Is there a process in place for acquiring this? We noticed Infosysta offers these files for Mobile for Jira and are hoping we can find the same with Confluence.

Thank you,

Mitch Dyer
Software Developer
General Dynamics Mission Systems
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile Server MDM (unsigned binaries)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We have in the past seen issues with the Content Indexing processing and application degradation due to large mp4 video attachments being viewed or downloaded. We attempted to alleviate this by decreasing the attachment size from default to 526.84 MB. This seemed to work for some time until recently where we have had two occurrences of a user viewing an mp4 attachment and it subsequently causing a block on our content indexing queue.
 For each occurrence once the video was closed out the Content Indexing started processing again.
h3. Suggested Solution

We actually have 2 suggestions to improve the way we work with attachments that would help in this case:
 # Would like to limit the attachments size per file type, so we can limit the size of videos being attached.
 # Would like to be able to choose which file types can be uploaded or which should be restricted without using a third-party plugin for that.

h3. Why this is important

To avoid issues with the Content Indexing processing and application degradation due to large mp4 video attachments being viewed or downloaded.
h3. Workaround
 * Use third-party plugins to restrict file types from being attached.
fields.summary: Would like to limit attachment size in Confluence per file type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When using the [Page Index Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-index-macro-182682092.html] in a large Space with more pages than the configured {{page.index.macro.max.pages}} threshold, the macro won't be rendered in the page showing a message as below.
 !space_index_message_img001.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
The macro could render the pages until it reaches the threshold, providing the user with some information instead of none.
Also, it could simply provide the summary count of pages starting with each letter and dynamically render the pages' title when a letter is selected by the user.

h3. Why this is important
This is important for a better user experience.
While the Confluence administrator can limit how many pages are rendered/processed by the Macro, the user can still see content, even on a large Space.
 
h3. Workaround 
None so far.
fields.summary: As a user I want Page Index Macro in Confluence to render the pages until it reaches the page.index.macro.max.pages threshold

fields.description:
Confluence appears to ignore Tomcat Datasource DB config for this check. I get the nag screen "Your database connection pool size is not configured. The recommended minimum size is 60" after changing to DS config following these instructions - [https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf64/configuring-a-datasource-connection-936511522.html#Configuringadatasourceconnection-3.ConfigurethedatasourceinTomcat] 
 According to  [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/startup-check-database-connection-pool-size-960713815.html] this shouldn't be the case.

I'll attach server.xml, web.xml and confluence.cfg.xml files. They clearly show maxTotal size is 70 with HTTP maxThreads of 56.

It just looks like the check assumes you have configured c3p0 and is probbaly using the default value for it since it's not configured.

 

h3. Workaround
Use C3P0.
fields.summary: Confluence DB Connection Pool Startup Check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Space Wizard fails with "An unknown server error has occurred" after deactivating server app with space blueprint

h3. Steps to Reproduce (You may need to shift-reload the page before launching the space wizard)
 # Have an add-on installed that provides at least on space blueprint
# Deactivate this add-on
# Try to create a new space with the space wizard (Spaces -> Create Space)

h3. Expected Results
The wizard shows the space blueprints to select from.

h3. Actual Results
The space wizard shows "An unknown server error has occurred"
 !space-wizard.png|thumbnail! 
The logfile shows this:
{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] ..... WARN [http-nio-1990-exec-7] [confluence.impl.hibernate.ConfluenceHibernateTransactionManager] doRollback Performing rollback. Transactions:
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] ->[PluginReadWriteTx]: PROPAGATION_REQUIRED,ISOLATION_DEFAULT (Session #.....)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] – referer: ...../confluence/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=PP&title=x | url: /confluence/rest/create-dialog/1.0/space-blueprint/dialog/web-items | traceId: ..... | userName: .....
{code}

Checking the dev console logs:
The call {{GET /rest/create-dialog/1.0/space-blueprint/dialog/web-items}} results in {code}{"errorCode":500,"errorType":"UNKNOWN"}{code}

h3. Notes
This problem occurs on Confluence 6.11.2 and above (although we did not test every single released version of Confluence), but not on 6.11.1 and below (again, we tested some 6.x and 5.10.9 which did not show the problem). The release notes to 6.11.2 seem not to relate to this issue ...

If the add-on is reactivated, everything works fine again.

The problem shows on MySQL, PostgreSQL, and H2. It occurs in the Atlassian SDK as well as in production.

h3. Workaround
The workaround mentioned in https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Confluence-add-Space-fails-An-unknown-server-error-has-occurred/qaq-p/893077 fixes the problem. In fact, dropping the AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO after server stop, removing the plugin cache directories, and restarting the server also fixes the problem: new spaces can again be created.

{code:sql}
DROP TABLE AO_54C900_SPACE_BLUEPRINT_AO;
{code}

There is a minor difference in the table between the 6.11.1 and 6.14.0: The name column contains label keys instead of labels in the NAME column. But replacing these with arbitrary strings did not fix the problem. Even if the server is restarted and the plugin cache dirs are cleared.
fields.summary: Space Wizard fails after deactivating server app with space blueprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When loading a page with the [Page Index Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-index-macro-182682092.html], the page takes a long time to render.
If a timeout is configured (i.e. from a proxy), then the page is not loaded because of it.

Depending on how many times the macro is loaded at the same time, it may overload the Confluence server and eventually make it unusable.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a fresh install of Confluence.
# Login to Confluence as an _admin_ (part of the {{confluence-administrators}} group).
# Create a sample Space and add thousands of pages to it.
 #* 1k pages is enough as a proof of concept.
 #* If you want to add more complexity to the issue, create 4.5k pages.
# Create a page in the same space and add the Page Index Macro.
 #* When the page is loaded after saving it, the macro will render fast -- this occurs because the _admin_ bypass the page restrictions validation.
# Login to Confluence as a regular user (*not* part of the {{confluence-administrators}} group).
# Access the page with the Page Index Macro.


h3. Expected Results
A page with the Page Index Macro will load within an acceptable time and the user won't experience a delay on rendering the macro.

h3. Actual Results
The page takes a long time to load, but will eventually.
In a simple computer, this is the time the macro takes to render depending on the number of pages within the Space:
||Number\\of pages||Time (s)||
|100|0|
|250|0|
|500|8|
|1,000|32|
|2,500|252|
|4,998|961|

The results may differ depending on the HW used to run the tests, but it is clear the time to render the macro doesn't scale linearly with the number of pages.

h3. Notes
The situation may worsen because the macro is rendered synchronously. That means Confluence must fetch the macro content before retrieving any content to the user's client (browser).
The user might think the request was not processed and may try to refresh the page or try to access it in other browser windows, triggering new threads that will add more overhead to the Confluence _backend_.

Depending on several parameters (number of users trying to access the same page, an user refreshing the page multiple times, complexity of the Space), this macro may create a situation on which the HW resources (CPU, memory) will be highly consumed and eventually bring the instance down (or make it unusable to the users).

h5. How to identify if affected by this issue

Taking thread dumps during periods of high load, or before restarting Confluence on the event of an incident, shows one or more HTTP threads stuck with a similar stack trace as below.
{code}
"http-nio-26132-exec-8" #63 daemon prio=5 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fc57bf64000 nid=0xb503 runnable [0x0000700014981000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
(...)
	at org.hibernate.query.internal.AbstractProducedQuery.doList(AbstractProducedQuery.java:1441)
	at org.hibernate.query.internal.AbstractProducedQuery.list(AbstractProducedQuery.java:1410)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateContentPermissionSetDao.lambda$getInheritedContentPermissionSets$2(HibernateContentPermissionSetDao.java:109)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateContentPermissionSetDao$$Lambda$1101/1350530201.doInHibernate(Unknown Source)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateTemplate.doExecute(HibernateTemplate.java:361)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate5.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:315)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateContentPermissionSetDao.getInheritedContentPermissionSets(HibernateContentPermissionSetDao.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultInheritedContentPermissionManager.getInheritedContentPermissionSets(DefaultInheritedContentPermissionManager.java:44)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultInheritedContentPermissionManager.getInheritedContentPermissionSetsIncludeEdit(DefaultInheritedContentPermissionManager.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.queryAndCache(CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.getInheritedContentPermissionSets(CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.java:62)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.getInheritedContentPermissionSetsIncludeEdit(CachingInheritedContentPermissionManager.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.getInheritedContentPermissionSets(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:155)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.hasInheritedContentLevelViewPermissions(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:256)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.core.DefaultContentPermissionManager.hasContentLevelPermission(DefaultContentPermissionManager.java:191)
(...)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy213.hasContentLevelPermission(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.PagePermissionsDelegate.hasContentLevelViewPermission(PagePermissionsDelegate.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.PagePermissionsDelegate.canView(PagePermissionsDelegate.java:20)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.PagePermissionsDelegate.canView(PagePermissionsDelegate.java:13)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.TargetToLatestVersionDecorator.canView(TargetToLatestVersionDecorator.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor$$Lambda$1490/328114757.test(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor.checkAccess(SharedAccessInterceptor.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.delegate.SharedAccessInterceptor.canView(SharedAccessInterceptor.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.Permission$1.checkAgainst(Permission.java:17)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermissionNoExemptions(DefaultPermissionManager.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultPermissionManager.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultPermissionManager.getPermittedEntities(DefaultPermissionManager.java:149)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor2077.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
(...)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy214.getPermittedEntities(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.advanced.IndexMacro.fetchPages(IndexMacro.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.macros.advanced.IndexMacro.getHtml(IndexMacro.java:86)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.radeox.macros.AbstractHtmlGeneratingMacro.execute(AbstractHtmlGeneratingMacro.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.macro.RadeoxCompatibilityMacro.execute(RadeoxCompatibilityMacro.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.renderer.v2.macros.RadeoxCompatibilityMacro.execute(RadeoxCompatibilityMacro.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.execute(ResourceAwareMacroDecorator.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.V2CompatibilityMacro.execute(V2CompatibilityMacro.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.macro.LazyLoadingMacroWrapper.execute(LazyLoadingMacroWrapper.java:24)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller.executeMacro(ViewMacroMarshaller.java:255)
(...)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DefaultRenderer.render(DefaultRenderer.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.DeviceTypeAwareRenderer.render(DeviceTypeAwareRenderer.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.ViewPageAction.execute(ViewPageAction.java:270)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:168)
(...)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.SocketProcessorBase.run(SocketProcessorBase.java:49)
	- locked <0x0000000789650a78> (a org.apache.tomcat.util.net.NioEndpoint$NioSocketWrapper)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}

Checking what Confluence does on the database, most of the time it is performing queries to validate if the current user has enough permissions to view the pages within the target Space.
Thousands of queries similar to the ones below may be found in the DB transaction log.
{code}
select contentent2_.CONTENTID as col_0_0_ from CONTENT page0_ left outer join CONFANCESTORS ancestors1_ on page0_.CONTENTID=ancestors1_.DESCENDENTID left outer join CONTENT contentent2_ on ancestors1_.ANCESTORID=contentent2_.CONTENTID where page0_.CONTENTTYPE='PAGE' and page0_.CONTENTID=$1

select contentper0_.ID as ID1_15_, contentper0_.CONT_PERM_TYPE as CONT_PER2_15_, contentper0_.CONTENT_ID as CONTENT_3_15_, contentper0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION4_15_, contentper0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD5_15_ from CONTENT_PERM_SET contentper0_ where contentper0_.CONT_PERM_TYPE=$1 and (contentper0_.CONTENT_ID in ($2))
{code}

With [log profiling enabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/troubleshooting-slow-performance-using-page-request-profiling-200987.html] you will notice most of the time is spent while doing permission management tasks.
{code}
2019-02-05 16:41:33,842 DEBUG [http-nio-26132-exec-8] [atlassian.util.profiling.UtilTimerStack] log [961657ms] - /c6132/display/SO5000/A+Page+Index+Macro
  [13ms] - UserAccessor.getUserByName()
(...)
      [960243ms] - XW Interceptor: After defaultStack: /pages/viewpage.action (ViewPageAction.execute())
        [960243ms] - XW Interceptor: After validatingStack: /pages/viewpage.action (ViewPageAction.execute())
          [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
          [958024ms] - DefaultRenderer.render
            [958024ms] - DefaultRenderer.renderWithResult
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
              [0ms] - SpaceManager.getSpace()
              [5ms] - PageManager.getPageCount()
              [237ms] - PageManager.getPagesWithPermissions()
              [957323ms] - PermissionManager.getPermittedEntities()
              [124ms] - Rendering velocity template: com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/macros/advanced/alphaindex.vm
              [1ms] - UserAccessor.getUserProfilePicture()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getUserProfilePicture()
              [0ms] - UserAccessor.getPropertySet()
(...)
{code}

h3. Workaround
The Confluence administrator may add the below JVM argument to restrict the macro from running on large spaces:
{code}
-Dpage.index.macro.max.pages=500
{code}
_Check [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] to know how to configure system properties._

Users will still be able to add the macro to pages, but when loading the page, the macro will render a message as the one below without running its background job:
 !space_index_message_img001.png|thumbnail! 

(!) _Note that you must be in one of the versions that fix bug [CONFSERVER-55450|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-55450] to have this functionality working as expected._
fields.summary: Using the Page Index Macro in a Space with thousands of pages takes a long time to complete and may overload the Confluence server

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Depending on the number of pages of the Space, the [Page Index Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/page-index-macro-182682092.html] in Confluence may take a long time render the content.
The task takes a long time on the server side (_backend_), delaying the load of the remaining of the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
The Page Index Macro should be rendered asynchronously, allowing the whole page to be loaded to the user even if the contents to render the macro have not been fetched.
While the macro is fetching content from the _backend_, a friendly message should appear in the page where the macro is placed so the user knows it is still running.

h3. Why this is important
The Confluence user may not have the understanding this is a time consuming macro, which would delay the rendering of the whole page.
Because of this, they may refresh the page or try to open it again in a new browser window, which may worsen the situation in the _backend_.
 
h3. Workaround 
If the [Cache for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/152/cache-for-confluence?hosting=server&tab=overview] App by Bob Swift is available, then the user can wrap the Page Index Macro with the [Future Macro|https://bobswift.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CACHE/pages/42631201/Future+Macro].
fields.summary: As a user I want Page Index Macro in Confluence to be rendered asynchronously to improve overal page loading time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you insert a Table of Content macro above an Office Word macro that displays the contents of a Word file with headings, the anchors in the ToC macro just brings you to the top of the page instead of the section of the page where the correct heading is.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page.
# Attach a Word file that contains multiple headings.
# Insert a ToC macro to the page.
# Insert an Office Word macro to the page and choose to display the file you've just attached in Step #2.
# Go to the page and click on any of the headings that appear in the ToC macro.

h3. Expected Results
The anchor should bring you to the part of the page where the heading is at.

h3. Actual Results
You either remain at the top of the page or you get brought to the top of the page, if you already weren't.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: ToC anchors don't work when the headings are from the 'Office Word' macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Starting from Confluence 6.13, admins can delete users that are unsynced from Confluence. Unsynced users are users that are not synced any more when an external user directory is being synchronized. This could be because the user has been removed from the external directory or it is because the user directory filters no longer include that user etc.
While this feature is useful, the current implementation only allows the deletion of these users individually and there is no option to perform bulk delete.

h3. Suggested Solution
Having the bulk delete feature would greatly help.
fields.summary: Provide the functionality to perform bulk delete for unsynced users
