fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the Multimedia macro to view videos, it might work or not. The video start but stops at a certain time saying that they are either corrupted or run into a decoding problem. It's unclear what causes the problem reported here since it's not consistent.

h3. Steps to replicate

# Install Confluence 6.12.x with either Oracle/Adopt java
# Create a test space/page
# Remain on the page Editor mode and Drag'n drop a mp4 or mov file (it will automatically become a multimedia macro), best if it's around 30mb or more.
# Execute the video with the browser dev console + network open to monitor the error.
# Firefox and Chrome were used and had different results depending on the file, not its type.
# We're going to see the below errors:
h4. In Chrome
{code:java}
:8092/confluence/download/attachments/7110694/4K%20VIDEO%20ultrahd%20hdr%20sony%204K%20VIDEOS%20demo%20test%20nature%20relaxation%20movie%20for%204k%20oled%20tv.mp4:1 GET http://localhost:8092/confluence/download/attachments/7110694/4K%20VIDEO%20ultrahd%20hdr%20sony%204K%20VIDEOS%20demo%20test%20nature%20relaxation%20movie%20for%204k%20oled%20tv.mp4 net::ERR_CONTENT_LENGTH_MISMATCH 304
{code}
h4. In Firefox
{code:java}
Media resource http://localhost:8092/confluence/download/attachments/4980755/LED%20Sign%20Basics%20TEST-14min.mov could not be decoded.
DACI+register
Media resource http://localhost:8092/confluence/download/attachments/4980755/LED%20Sign%20Basics%20TEST-14min.mov could not be decoded, error: Error Code: NS_ERROR_DOM_MEDIA_DECODE_ERR (0x806e0004)
Details: mozilla::MediaResult mozilla::AppleATDecoder::DecodeSample(mozilla::MediaRawData *): Error decoding audio sample: 1852797029 @ 234196462
{code}

h3. Expected results

Video will run without problems.

h3. Actual results

Video suddenly stops and needs to be started again from where it stopped.

h3. Bug variation
The problem reported here is very similar to an older bug and looks like it's derived from:
- [Multimedia macro does not render mp4 videos|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-42759]

h3. Workaround

May use the user macro from:
- https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/What-are-you-using-for-streaming-video-to-confluence/qaq-p/614294
fields.summary: Multimedia macro doesn't work properly with mp4 and mov videos

fields.description:
h1. Use Case

I have a page to host meeting notes sub-pages.

I would like to list all the meeting notes in the main page using the _Page Property Report_ macro, as my meeting notes have properties.
h1. Issue

Currently, I am forced to label my meeting notes, when it would be sufficient to just use the filter _With ancestor_.
h1. Known Workaround

Label all your meeting notes (i.e. with the default label meeting notes) and use it in combination with the filter _With ancestor_.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro: Change selection criteria, label should not be mandatory

fields.description:
When I first use the Meeting Notes template it creates the index page and the new meeting notes page at the same level i.e. root. It would be more helpful if it created the specific meeting notes pages beneath the index page. And if you create subsequent meeting notes pages it will only put them beneath the index page if you're on that page and use the blueprint again or use the macro on the index page. Blueprints are meant to be a way to help you neatly organize your space but this behavior seems to go against that.

fyi there is an old bug on this https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-31035 that was closed as not a bug. So I'm entering this as a suggestion.
fields.summary: Meeting Notes blueprints should create new page under index page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* If a user has a lot of questions in Questions for Confluence it is hard to update its tags since this has to be done individually for each task.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Add the ability of bulk updating question's tags in Questions for Confluence.
fields.summary: Bulk update question's tags in Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently we organized the *'User Profile' > Drafts* page by Space name, and only under each Space it's organized by last updated date or time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Would like to have an option to order all pages in *'User Profile' > Drafts* by the time of the last update instead of only organizing by Space name.
e.g. 
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-04 at 13.55.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Why this is important
It would be helpful to see the most recently worked on Drafts to be able to get back to working on it faster.

h3. Workaround 
For now we have two options
# Scroll down until you find the Space and page you want to work on again.
OR
# Use the browser search to find the Page by name.
fields.summary: I would like to order Drafts in Confluence by last updated date so I can find most recently worked on drafts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The [embedded database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/embedded-h2-database-145098285.html] in Confluence is ONLY supported during evaluation per the above linked documentation.

{quote}The embedded H2 database is only supported while you are evaluating Confluence. You must migrate to a supported external database before using Confluence as a production system. 
{quote}

However, it may not be clear from this that the embedded database is also not supported when upgrading the system. This can cause many issues such as the one from this forum post:

http://h2-database.66688.n3.nabble.com/TimeNanos-out-of-range-when-using-different-version-of-jar-No-check-when-DB-upgraded-td4033636.html

In general, the solution for this is to migrate to a supported database.

h3. Suggested Solution
Clarify on the documentation that the H2 database is only supported within evaluation, including when upgrading or migrating a Confluence instance.
fields.summary: Embedded database unsupported for upgrades

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

If the macro is used in small frames or with smaller screen sizes the view is not useful and some basic functionality is lacking.

If not all tabs are visible, three dots are shown instead and if clicked a sub-menu will be shown. in the background of the sub-menu when loading a large loading circle is shown and only a part of that is inside the visible space. 

h3. Additional points:

In the same setup clicking on the network tab: If the user does not have a network configured a hint will be show. The hint will be shown off screen in the centre of the page and one must scroll to read it. There is also no link to network setup in this area, and it is not clear to users where to find it.

Note: The above appears in all browsers. Tested in latest versions of Chrome, Firefox and Safari.
fields.summary: Usability issues with  recently-updated-dashboard macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Team Calendar Custom Event display the Event description and Event Title in the Month View compared to the Default Events that only display the Event Title.

h3. Environment
Reproducible with Confluence Team Calendar version 6.0.25

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Team calendar plugin in Confluence.
# Add a Calendar and create a *Custom Event*
# Create an Event in the Calendar by choosing the custom event and fill in the *What*, *Who*, *When* and *Description*.
!customfield.png|thumbnail!
# Preview the Calendar in *Month* View.

h3. Expected Results
The Time (specified in *When*), User (specified in *Who*) and Title (specified in *What*) will be display in the Month* View similar to the Default Events.
!default.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The Time (specified in *When*), User (specified in *Who*), Description (specified in *Descriptions*) and Title (specified in *What*) will be display making the *Month* View looks messy with a long event description.
!custom.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Leave the *Description* empty when adding the custom event.
fields.summary: Team Calendar Custom Event display the Event description and Event Title in the Month View

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

Page up and Page down key in editor mode does not work as expected:
 * When there are no sections, page/up down key moves to the top/bottom of the page
 * When the page contains multiple sections, page up/down key moves to the top/bottom of that section users are currently viewing

h4. How to replicate - No sections
 # Create a page with long content
 # On Editor mode, use 'Page Up' or 'Page Down'
 # Expected results: The Page up/down button acts as a scroll

h4. Actual results

Pressing Page Up brought you to the Top of the page
 Pressing Page Down brought you to the End of the page
h4. How to replicate #2 - when the page *that contain multiple sections*.

When pressing on the 'Page Up' key, the user is normally brought one page up with every press of the button. However, when the page contains multiple sections and the user is currently viewing content from a lower section, the 'Page Up' key brings them to the top of the first section in the page. This only affects *Google Chrome* and pages *that contain multiple sections*.
 # Create a page with 5 sections.
 # Insert long content in sections 3 and 4.
 # Save the page.
 # Edit the page again.
 # Use 'Page Down' so your view is around section 3 or 4.
 # Press on 'Page Up'.
 # Expected results: Your page view only goes one page up.

h4. Actual results

You get brought to the top of the page where the first section is at.
h3. Environments
 # Multiple sections issue observed in Chrome, on Confluence version 6.13.1
 # Both issues observed in Firefox 68.0.1, on Confluence version 6.15.7

h4. Workaround / Notes
 * Issue not observed in view mode
 * Use a different browser (e.g. IE).
 * If you're using a keyboard with no 'Page Up/Down' keys (i.e. MacBook), the issue is not reproducible using the shortcut for those keys (FN + Arrow key up/down).
fields.summary: Page Up and Page Down key issues in Editor mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Mouse Cursor displayed incorrectly when hovering over attached Image in Confluence Page

In Confluence 6.14.0 when hovering the mouse cursor to an attached image in the page, the mouse cursor display as a "Move" cursor instead of the "Hand" cursor that can be seen in the older versions of Confluence
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.14.0
 Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 Internet Explorer 11.523.17134.0
 Firefox 64.0.2 (64-bit)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload an image attachment to a Page and save it
 # In view mode, hover the mouse over to the image

h3. Expected Results

Mouse cursor changed to the "Hand" cursor
 !hand cursor.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Mouse cursor changed to the "Move" cursor
 !move cursor.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Information

When the page is refreshed, hovering mouse over to the image actually shows the "Hand" cursor correctly until the page has finished loaded
 [^6.14 image cursor.mp4]
h3. Workaround

Disable TinyMCE 4 editor and rollback to v3 (this is only recommended for Confluence 6.14 and should be reverted again when upgrading to Confluence 7.0 or newer):
 # Visit http://<conf-URL>/admin/darkfeatures.action
 # Add frontend.editor.v4.disable to the list at the bottom
 ** We noticed that adding *frontend.editor.v4.disable* in dark feature can have adverse affects to the color picker in edit mode (tested in Confluence 7.5.2). The color picker may not render as expected for the text color option or the table color.

OR

The workaround that has been shared in CONFCLOUD-57252 (preferred for any version of Confluence):
 # Go to *General Configuration* *>* [*Stylesheet*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/styling-confluence-with-css-166528400.html#StylingConfluencewithCSS-GettingStarted]
 # Click *Edit* and paste in the custom CSS below:
{code:java}
.wiki-content img.confluence-embedded-image, .wiki-content img.editor-inline-macro, .wiki-content table.wysiwyg-macro 
{     cursor: pointer !important;     } 
{code}
 # Click *Save*
fields.summary: Mouse Cursor displayed incorrectly when hovering over attached Image in Confluence Page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no way to pre-set the *Trusted Domain* for the Companion App before distributing it out.


h3. Why this is important
In a large organization if the system administrator were to distribute the Companion App to all Confluence users, every users will need to click on "Trust this Domain" for the first time editing attachment in the Confluence.

Having an option to pre-set the Trusted Domain before distributing it out can cut down the hassle from the users to seek for clarification before _Trusting_ something in their computer.


 !image-2019-02-01-10-01-19-961.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Allowing admin to pre-set Trusted Domain before distributing Companion App

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Filter Results Jira Gadget in Confluence showing arrow icon as square box while sorting column manually

When the *Filter Results Gadget* from Jira is added into Confluence page, sorting the columns supposed to show an arrow beside the column name that indicates ascending or descending order. 

The arrow wasn't able to be displayed in Confluence and appears to be a square box instead

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.14.0
Jira 7.13.0


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Application Links between Confluence and Jira
# Subscribe to the Filter Results Gadget in Confluence. The URL will be something like below:
{code}
http://<YourJiraURL>/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml
{code}
# Add the *Filter Results Gadget* in Confluence page
# Sort any column by clicking on the column header
 !Sort Column.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
An arrow icon will show beside the sorted column to indicate whether it is sorted in ascending or descending order
 !expected result.png|thumbnail! 
(i) Arrow is showing properly in Jira

h3. Actual Results
A square box appears beside the sorted column instead of the arrow icon
 !actual result.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter Results Jira Gadget in Confluence showing arrow icon as square box while sorting column manually

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Issues Macro in Confluence will sometimes lose the ability to sort some columns. Some of the columns will remain sortable, others will not.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence
 * Jira (connected via Application Links)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Link Confluence and Jira
 # Create a Page
 # Insert a Jira Issues Macro
 ## Choose a project of filter
 ## Make no other changes
 ## Save the macro
 # Save the page

h3. Expected Results

Most, if not all, fields should be sortable
h3. Actual Results

Some fields cannot be sorted.

The {{/rest/jiraanywhere/1.0/jira/clientIds/}} call returns the macro. In order for a field to be sortable, the header must have {{<span class="jim-table-header-content">}} wrapped around it. The non-sortable fields are missing this span.

!source.jpg|thumbnail!
_(Above, the 'Key' field can be sorted, but the 'Summary' field cannot)_

h3. Notes

This seems to not happen after a recent Confluence start-up, but after running for some time, it happens. It can be observed across pages, spaces, filters, projects, browsers, and users. Clearing the browser cache or using another browser does not fix it.
h3. Workaround

Disable, then re-enable the *Confluence Jira Plugin* in Confluence.

or

Re-start Confluence
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro in Confluence sometimes loses sorting ability on some columns

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pasting image from any application into the page from IE11 will generate an image that is blurry.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Take a snapshot with Window "Snip tool"
 # In IE11 create a new page
 # Paste that image from clipboard.
 # Observe the image in the editor
 # Save/publish the page and observe the image in preview.

h3. Expected Results
The image is added and resolution is same as from original in edit and in the preview.

h3. Actual Results
The image has an incorrect resolution in preview and on the second edit of the page.

h3. Notes
The issue is not visible in Chrome and FF.

If the image is added trough IE, src of the image will be (observe thumbnail part)
{{/c6140/download/thumbnails/1245185/image2019-1-31_4-41-41.png?version=1&modificationDate=1548938517710&api=v2}}
If the image is added trough Chrome, src will be 
{{/c6140/download/attachments/1245185/image2019-1-31_13-45-40.png?version=1&modificationDate=1548938740160&api=v2}}

h3. Workaround
Use FF or Chrome as the issue is not observable in them.
fields.summary: Pasting image into page from IE will generate blurry image.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* When you insert a Jira Issue Filter, the icon will be larger than inserting a single jira issue.

Example:
 !jiraissue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Decrease the size of the Jira Issue Filter for something similar to a single jira issue.

h3. Why this is important   

* If you have a page that contains a lot of Jira Issue Filter macros, the user will have to scroll down the page while editing it. If the icon is smaller, it can improve the usability of the editor.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Decrease Jira Issue Filter macro size

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* The colors of the *Status* column of the Jira Issue macro cannot be changed to match the colors shown in Jira, or even to show different colors. In Confluence, the _In Progress_ status, for example, is in blue, while in Jira it is showing in yellow.

h3. Suggested Solution  

* Add the ability to change the default colors of the *Status* column items.

h3. Why this is important   

* Users might want to change the colors to reflect certain scenarios of their business cases.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Change the Status color of the Jira Issue macro

fields.description:
Roadmaps typically span months or years.  And therefore using the horizontal scroll bar is needed to see 'today'.

Suggest adding a option/setting to default to 'current date'.  So when users load the page with the macro, the view of the roadmap is centered on 'today'.
fields.summary: Roadmap macro: default landing on 'today'

fields.description:
h3. Steps to replicate
# Login into Confluence.
# Type any keyword in the search box before the UI completely loaded.
# Remove the keyword and re-enter the keyword multiple time.

h3. Environment
Confluence version 6.14.0

h3. Expected Results
Search autocomplete/result will appear.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence Search keep loading even after navigating to another page.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page/open a new tab and wait until Confluence UI completely loaded to perform the search.

fields.description:

The content can be seen and edited

h3. Actual Results
